result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Winzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling or combination of the two.  When not fully engaged, complete 9 hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, unless has valid prescription and only take as prescribed.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA with follow through.  Complete Corrective Thinking Program.  DNA sample.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 3:35pm
INCLUDES 15CM2119, 15CM2425, 16CM188, 16CM475, 16CM1705, 16CM1781
State of WI appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays

Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 15CM2119 Ct. 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia: Serve 30 days MCJ. 190 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM2425 Ct. 1 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor: Serve 9 months MCJ. Ct. 2 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500): Serve 9 months MCJ. 220 days jail credit granted on both counts. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM188 Ct. 1 Possession of THC: Serve 6 months MCJ. 190 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM475 Ct. 1 Possession of THC: Serve 6 months MCJ. 190 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1705 Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500- PTAC: Serve 9 months MCJ. Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor: Serve 9 months MCJ. 220 days credit granted on both counts.
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1781 Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500: Serve 9 months MCJ. Ct. 4 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer: Serve 9 months MCJ. 190 days jail credit granted on both counts.
ALL SENTENCES TO  RUN CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER. COURT ORDERS: any outstanding costs in each case are to be converted into civil judgment.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete corrective thinking program. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, unless has valid prescription and only take as prescriped. Perform 60 hours community service. Maintain GFE in full time employement/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week. Restitution to be determined within next 60 days. Pay CC. Pay DNA surchargea and provide sample. ONLY in 16CM1781 Ct. 5 (Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor) Serve 6 months MCJ, may be with huber release for work, work search, or treatment if meets jail criteria. 

Atty Kohn to provide stipulation to court on jail credit if revoked on all cases, EXCEPT Ct. 5 in 16CM1781. 
COURT DOES NOT allow expungement due to numerous charges deft has plead to
